Articles.Content: [COLOR=#000000][FONT=Helvetica Neue]does anyone that plays kerbal space program have a game save with bases on the planets and space stations above them i cant figure out this game its very difficult.[/FONT][/COLOR]

On to your main question. I'm not sure why you want this. One part of the fun in this game is the feeling of success. Just give the game some time and you will understand it. Browse the forums and find some tutorials. Scott Manley has good tutorials on youtube. Hell, try the tutorials that KSP gives you if you must. I was right there with you a while ago, but I will guarantee you that having prebuilt bases and stations is not going to be fun. There would be hardly anything to do. Just keep to it mang. Edited November 19, 2015 by Claw

I can ask around. The rocket builder's subforum is a better place for this- granted a save request and not a craft request but that community doesn't mind the difference. Edited November 19, 2015 by Claw

I've deleted some posts. Stay on topic please, and provide a new kerbonaut some assistance.

[hr][/hr][hr][/hr]

alinda,

What exactly are you needing help with? We can provide assistance with pictures and some advice, which might be more helpful to you in designing and building your own designs. Are looking for some examples? Or do are you having problems with anything specific?

Also, welcome to the forums! :D

Cheers,
~Claw

[quote name='alinda'][COLOR=#000000][FONT=Helvetica Neue]does anyone that plays kerbal space program have a game save with bases on the planets and space stations above them i cant figure out this game its very difficult.[/FONT][/COLOR][/QUOTE]
I sympathize. It is easy for us veterans to forget that KSP is pretty hard, especially at first when you haven't figured anything out yet. While I don't have a save to offer you, I can give the following advice:

Have a look in the [URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forums/20-The-Spacecraft-Exchange"]Spacecraft Exchange[/URL] and download some craft that look appealing to you. If you don't have to worry about if the craft is even capable of doing what you want to do it can help you focus on your flying skills.

Also look at our [URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forums/54-Tutorials"]Tutorials section[/URL], especially the [URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/28352-The-Drawing-Board-A-library-of-tutorials-and-other-useful-information"]Drawing Board[/URL] (a categorized index of tutorials). Lots of smart people have explained KSP's concepts, both simple and complex, in text and video form. Focus on the basics: How to get to orbit, how to build a spacecraft, how to get to another celestial body and land on it, how to rendezvous and dock.

Draw inspiration from others. Have a look at the epicly long and content-filled [URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/29533-What-did-you-do-in-KSP-today"]What did you do in KSP today?[/URL] thread (start at the end, though). Read some [URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forums/55-Mission-Reports"]Mission Reports[/URL] and see what people are doing and how. Don't be afraid to [s]shamelessly copy[/s] learn from the designs and techniques of others.

Finally, if you get stuck, swing by the [URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forums/15-Gameplay-Questions-and-Tutorials"]Gameplay Questions[/URL] section, where people who have been where you are and figured out how to solve the challenges you face are waiting to give good advice on how to step up your game.

If you really want to, you could always use [URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/37756-1-0-5-HyperEdit-v1-4-2-Nov-11-2015-Teleporter-Orbit-Planet-Editor-More"]HyperEdit[/URL] to move your bases and space stations into place. But as others have indicated, this would quickly feel very hollow. Getting a simple 1-man capsule into orbit around Kerbin will feel better than hyperediting an entire base on Moho.
